channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: PsySafe: A Comprehensive Framework for Psychological-based Attack, Defense, and Evaluation of Multi-agent System Safety
item.description: We anticipate that our framework and observations will provide valuable insights for further research into the safety of multi-agent systems.

item.title: RUMBoost: Gradient Boosted Random Utility Models
item.description: We introduce additional constraints on the ensembles to ensure three crucial features of the utility specifications: (i) dependency of the utilities of each alternative on only the attributes of that alternative, (ii) monotonicity of marginal utilities, and (iii) an intrinsically interpretable functional form, where the exact response of the model is known throughout the entire input space.

item.title: LightDiC: A Simple yet Effective Approach for Large-scale Digraph Representation Learning
item.description: Most existing graph neural networks (GNNs) are limited to undirected graphs, whose restricted scope of the captured relational information hinders their expressive capabilities and deployments in real-world scenarios.

item.title: Integrating Statistical Significance and Discriminative Power in Pattern Discovery
item.description: Pattern discovery plays a central role in both descriptive and predictive tasks across multiple domains.

item.title: VRMN-bD: A Multi-modal Natural Behavior Dataset of Immersive Human Fear Responses in VR Stand-up Interactive Games
item.description: Understanding and recognizing emotions are important and challenging issues in the metaverse era.

item.title: NeuroSynt: A Neuro-symbolic Portfolio Solver for Reactive Synthesis
item.description: At the core of the solver lies a seamless integration of neural and symbolic approaches to solving the reactive synthesis problem.

item.title: Temporal Blind Spots in Large Language Models
item.description: In this study, we aim to investigate the underlying limitations of general-purpose LLMs when deployed for tasks that require a temporal understanding.

item.title: Mastering Text-to-Image Diffusion: Recaptioning, Planning, and Generating with Multimodal LLMs
item.description: In this paper, we propose a brand new training-free text-to-image generation/editing framework, namely Recaption, Plan and Generate (RPG), harnessing the powerful chain-of-thought reasoning ability of multimodal LLMs to enhance the compositionality of text-to-image diffusion models.

item.title: TurboSVM-FL: Boosting Federated Learning through SVM Aggregation for Lazy Clients
item.description: Federated learning is a distributed collaborative machine learning paradigm that has gained strong momentum in recent years.

item.title: A Fair Evaluation of Various Deep Learning-Based Document Image Binarization Approaches
item.description: We evaluate them on different Document Image Binarization Contest (DIBCO) datasets and obtain very heterogeneous results.

item.title: FedGTA: Topology-aware Averaging for Federated Graph Learning
item.description: Existing FGL studies fall into two categories: (i) FGL Optimization, which improves multi-client training in existing machine learning models; (ii) FGL Model, which enhances performance with complex local models and multi-client interactions.

item.title: Broiler-Net: A Deep Convolutional Framework for Broiler Behavior Analysis in Poultry Houses
item.description: Detecting anomalies in poultry houses is crucial for maintaining optimal chicken health conditions, minimizing economic losses and bolstering profitability.

item.title: Beyond TreeSHAP: Efficient Computation of Any-Order Shapley Interactions for Tree Ensembles
item.description: While shallow decision trees may be interpretable, larger ensemble models like gradient-boosted trees, which often set the state of the art in machine learning problems involving tabular data, still remain black box models.

item.title: ALMs: Authorial Language Models for Authorship Attribution
item.description: In this paper, we introduce an authorship attribution method called Authorial Language Models (ALMs) that involves identifying the most likely author of a questioned document based on the perplexity of the questioned document calculated for a set of causal language models fine-tuned on the writings of a set of candidate author.

item.title: Unsupervised Machine Learning for the Classification of Astrophysical X-ray Sources
item.description: We provide a catalog of probabilistic classes for 8, 756 sources, comprising a total of 14, 507 detections, and demonstrate the success of the method at identifying emission from young stellar objects, as well as distinguishing between small-scale and large-scale compact accretors with a significant level of confidence.

item.title: Universal Neurons in GPT2 Language Models
item.description: In other words, are neural mechanisms universal across different models?

item.title: PointGL: A Simple Global-Local Framework for Efficient Point Cloud Analysis
item.description: Efficient analysis of point clouds holds paramount significance in real-world 3D applications.

item.title: Admission Prediction in Undergraduate Applications: an Interpretable Deep Learning Approach
item.description: This article addresses the challenge of validating the admission committee's decisions for undergraduate admissions.

item.title: NLCG-Net: A Model-Based Zero-Shot Learning Framework for Undersampled Quantitative MRI Reconstruction
item.description: Typical quantitative MRI (qMRI) methods estimate parameter maps after image reconstructing, which is prone to biases and error propagation.

item.title: Knowledge Navigation: Inferring the Interlocking Map of Knowledge from Research Trajectories
item.description: "If I have seen further, it is by standing on the shoulders of giants," Isaac Newton's renowned statement hints that new knowledge builds upon existing foundations, which means there exists an interdependent relationship between knowledge, which, yet uncovered, is implied in the historical development of scientific systems for hundreds of years.

item.title: Towards Effective and General Graph Unlearning via Mutual Evolution
item.description: With the rapid advancement of AI applications, the growing needs for data privacy and model robustness have highlighted the importance of machine unlearning, especially in thriving graph-based scenarios.

item.title: GI-PIP: Do We Require Impractical Auxiliary Dataset for Gradient Inversion Attacks?
item.description: Deep gradient inversion attacks expose a serious threat to Federated Learning (FL) by accurately recovering private data from shared gradients.

item.title: Subgroup analysis methods for time-to-event outcomes in heterogeneous randomized controlled trials
item.description: Identifying such heterogeneous treatment effects is key for precision medicine and many post-hoc analysis methods have been developed for that purpose.

item.title: SFC: Shared Feature Calibration in Weakly Supervised Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Specifically, we leverage the class prototypes that carry positive shared features and propose a Multi-Scaled Distribution-Weighted (MSDW) consistency loss for narrowing the gap between the CAMs generated through classifier weights and class prototypes during training.

item.title: Benchmarking Large Multimodal Models against Common Corruptions
item.description: This technical report aims to fill a deficiency in the assessment of large multimodal models (LMMs) by specifically examining the self-consistency of their outputs when subjected to common corruptions.

item.title: Less Could Be Better: Parameter-efficient Fine-tuning Advances Medical Vision Foundation Models
item.description: Parameter-efficient fine-tuning (PEFT) that was initially developed for exploiting pre-trained large language models has recently emerged as an effective approach to perform transfer learning on computer vision tasks.

item.title: Self-Labeling the Job Shop Scheduling Problem
item.description: Inspired by Semi- and Self-Supervised learning, we show that it is possible to easily train generative models by sampling multiple solutions and using the best one according to the problem objective as a pseudo-label.

item.title: VQC-Based Reinforcement Learning with Data Re-uploading: Performance and Trainability
item.description: This work empirically studies the performance and trainability of such VQC-based Deep Q-Learning models in classic control benchmark environments.

item.title: Language Models as Hierarchy Encoders
item.description: Interpreting hierarchical structures latent in language is a key limitation of current language models (LMs).

item.title: SEBERTNets: Sequence Enhanced BERT Networks for Event Entity Extraction Tasks Oriented to the Finance Field
item.description: In addition, motivated by recommendation system, we propose Hybrid Sequence Enhanced BERT Networks (HSEBERTNets for short), which uses a multi-channel recall method to recall all the corresponding event entity.

item.title: MolTailor: Tailoring Chemical Molecular Representation to Specific Tasks via Text Prompts
item.description: The agent accentuates task-relevant features in the molecular representation by understanding the natural language description of the task, just as a tailor customizes clothes for clients.

item.title: Efficient local linearity regularization to overcome catastrophic overfitting
item.description: Our regularization term can be theoretically linked to curvature of the loss function and is computationally cheaper than previous methods by avoiding Double Backpropagation.

item.title: Towards Reliable and Factual Response Generation: Detecting Unanswerable Questions in Information-Seeking Conversations
item.description: Specifically, our proposed method employs a sentence-level classifier to detect if the answer is present, then aggregates these predictions on the passage level, and eventually across the top-ranked passages to arrive at a final answerability estimate.

item.title: Robust Evaluation Measures for Evaluating Social Biases in Masked Language Models
item.description: Many evaluation measures are used to evaluate social biases in masked language models (MLMs).

item.title: Over-Reasoning and Redundant Calculation of Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) can solve problems step-by-step.

item.title: Linear Alignment: A Closed-form Solution for Aligning Human Preferences without Tuning and Feedback
item.description: This reliance limits the applicability of RLHF and hinders the development of professional assistants tailored to diverse human preferences.

item.title: InferAligner: Inference-Time Alignment for Harmlessness through Cross-Model Guidance
item.description: With the rapid development of large language models (LLMs), they are not only used as general-purpose AI assistants but are also customized through further fine-tuning to meet the requirements of different applications.

item.title: Exploiting Duality in Open Information Extraction with Predicate Prompt
item.description: Open information extraction (OpenIE) aims to extract the schema-free triplets in the form of (\emph{subject}, \emph{predicate}, \emph{object}) from a given sentence.

item.title: TreeMIL: A Multi-instance Learning Framework for Time Series Anomaly Detection with Inexact Supervision
item.description: Then, the subsequence features are extracted to determine the presence of collective anomalies.

item.title: Long-Term Fair Decision Making through Deep Generative Models
item.description: This paper studies long-term fair machine learning which aims to mitigate group disparity over the long term in sequential decision-making systems.

item.title: Automated Fusion of Multimodal Electronic Health Records for Better Medical Predictions
item.description: The widespread adoption of Electronic Health Record (EHR) systems in healthcare institutes has generated vast amounts of medical data, offering significant opportunities for improving healthcare services through deep learning techniques.

item.title: End-to-End Argument Mining over Varying Rhetorical Structures
item.description: Rhetorical Structure Theory implies no single discourse interpretation of a text, and the limitations of RST parsers further exacerbate inconsistent parsing of similar structures.

item.title: Pixel-Wise Recognition for Holistic Surgical Scene Understanding
item.description: This paper presents the Holistic and Multi-Granular Surgical Scene Understanding of Prostatectomies (GraSP) dataset, a curated benchmark that models surgical scene understanding as a hierarchy of complementary tasks with varying levels of granularity.

item.title: Are Latent Vulnerabilities Hidden Gems for Software Vulnerability Prediction? An Empirical Study
item.description: To bridge these gaps, we conduct a large-scale study on the latent vulnerable functions in two commonly used SV datasets and their utilization for function-level and line-level SV predictions.

item.title: FedRKG: A Privacy-preserving Federated Recommendation Framework via Knowledge Graph Enhancement
item.description: Federated Learning (FL) has emerged as a promising approach for preserving data privacy in recommendation systems by training models locally.

item.title: VONet: Unsupervised Video Object Learning With Parallel U-Net Attention and Object-wise Sequential VAE
item.description: Unsupervised video object learning seeks to decompose video scenes into structural object representations without any supervision from depth, optical flow, or segmentation.

item.title: Adaptive Global-Local Representation Learning and Selection for Cross-Domain Facial Expression Recognition
item.description: Specifically, the framework consists of separate global-local adversarial learning modules that learn domain-invariant global and local features independently.

item.title: Coevolving Artistic Images Using OMNIREP
item.description: We have recently developed OMNIREP, a coevolutionary algorithm to discover both a representation and an interpreter that solve a particular problem of interest.

item.title: Closing the Gap between TD Learning and Supervised Learning -- A Generalisation Point of View
item.description: Based on this analysis, we construct new datasets to explicitly test for this property, revealing that SL-based methods lack this stitching property and hence fail to perform combinatorial generalization.

item.title: Measuring Policy Distance for Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Furthermore, we extend MAPD to a customizable version, which can quantify differences among agent policies on specified aspects.
